body: Hello @BKTidswell, I'll take a look at it. Is this the video with the detections corresponding to the pickle you uploaded? Out of curiosity, do you face the same error with the box tracker?

Hello @jeylau The video does correspond to the pickle I uploaded. I just tried it and I do run into the same error with the box tracker, though I did not in version 2.2b8. This zip file is from the results of the box tracker.

[2020_7_28_27_TN_DN_F0_V1DLC_resnet50_DLC_2-2_4P_8F_Light_VentralMay10shuffle1_100000_bx.pickle.zip](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/files/6524787/2020_7_28_27_TN_DN_F0_V1DLC_resnet50_DLC_2-2_4P_8F_Light_VentralMay10shuffle1_100000_bx.pickle.zip)

Hey @BKTidswell, I figured what went on. When building the graph, we automatically calculate what the minimal gap size between pairs of tracklets is to ensure any pair can be stitched together. In your case, the value is not conservative enough and causes stitching to fail. While I work on a fix, you could programmatically stitch your tracklets as follows:
```
from deeplabcut.refine_training_dataset.stitch import TrackletStitcher

cfg = read_config(config_path)
stitcher = TrackletStitcher.from_pickle('your_pickle_file', n_tracks=8)
stitcher.build_graph(max_gap=50)
stitcher.stitch()
stitcher.write_tracks(output_name, cfg["individuals"])
```

issue.title: Catch failure to solve graph optimal flow

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
There were cases where our "black magic" fallback method (preflow push algorithm) failed to reconstruct the desired number of tracks, triggering a NotImplementedError.
This PR adds the missing implementation: We rebuild a graph from the remaining (unstitched) tracklets, relaxing all temporal constraints on possible graph edges, and solve this smaller problem.

Fixes #1260

body:
I just now  pulled and installed #1270 [latest commit](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/pull/1270/commits/67d1f3e9375d80008daa1fd233b0b6becbdc01d5) after running into a similar problem.  

In one set of videos (3 cameras of the same behavior for 3D), I have three birds. Based on the output of `create_video_with_all_detections`, one bird is well detected, one is mostly obscured (just 2 of 7 points visible), and one is visible but not well detected at all, so I wanted to extract outliers. The current model is working well for tracking most videos, so there is something about this particular video that is throwing it off.

The one bird is so poorly tracked that I know I really just need to extract frames and label. I'm thinking that simply a clearer error statement may be helpful for some users for when tracking is so poor that tracklets can't be stitched even with the fixes in this commit - and possibly an addition to the docs.

When I run `dlc.stitch_tracklets(config, pickle, n_tracks=3)` I get the following traceback:
<details>
<summary> n_tracks=3 Traceback</summary>

```python

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

-> 1676                         values=blocks[0], placement=slice(0, len(axes[0])), ndim=2
   1677                     )
```
